cleaned_text: in the fascinating life of Srinivasa Ramanujan appears to be complete: 'While on his death bed, the brilliant Indian mathematician Srinivasa Ramanujan cryptically wrote down functions he said came to him in dreams, with a hunch about how they behaved. Now [100 years later, researchers say they've proved he was right](http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/12/27/ramanujans-mock-modular-forms_n_2371680.html?utm_hp_ref=science). "We've solved the problems from his last mysterious letters. For people who work in this area of math, the problem has been open for 90 years," Emory University mathematician Ken Ono said.
